comment.body: Agree. This was because we got frustrated with `DynamoGateway`'s implementation as discussed. [We've found a better way now](https://github.com/ministryofjustice/bichard7-next-audit-logging/pull/295#discussion_r875680253)- this has all been removed 👍

pull_request.title: Sanitise old archived messages
pull_request.body:
Adds a new lambda to sanitise messages after 3 months (as currently configured)

* add sanitise-old-messages lambda
* added `updateEntryUnconditionally` and `fetchUnsanitised` methods to `AuditLogDynamoGateway`
* added `sanitiseMessage` method to `ApiClient`

An overview of the lambda is provided in [the README](../blob/BICAWS-1904-santise-old-messages/src/sanitise-old-messages/README.md)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@
+import { add } from "date-fns"
+import type { Client } from "pg"
+import { logger } from "shared"
+import type { ApiClient, AuditLog, AuditLogDynamoGateway, PromiseResult } from "shared-types"
+import { isError } from "shared-types"
+import type { SanitiseOldMessagesConfig } from "./config"
+
+export default class SanitiseOldMessages {
+  constructor(
+    private api: ApiClient,
+    private dynamo: AuditLogDynamoGateway,
+    private db: Client,
+    private config: SanitiseOldMessagesConfig
+  ) {
+    this.api = api
+    this.dynamo = dynamo
+    this.db = db
+    this.config = config
+  }
+
+  public async sanitiseOldMessages() {
+    logger.debug("Fetching messages to sanitise")
+
+    // Fetch messages over the configured age threshold from dynamo
+    const messages = await this.dynamo.fetchUnsanitised(this.config.MESSAGE_FETCH_BATCH_NUM)
+    if (isError(messages)) {
+      logger.error({ message: "Unable to fetch messages from dynamo, exiting", error: messages })
+      return
+    }
+
+    // Call postgres and check if we should sanitise each message
+    for (const message of messages) {
+      const shouldSanitiseResult = await this.shouldSanitise(message, this.config.SANITISE_AFTER)
+      if (isError(shouldSanitiseResult) || shouldSanitiseResult.error) {
+        logger.error({
+          message: "Unable to check if message is sanitised",
+          error: shouldSanitiseResult,
+          messageId: message.messageId
+        })
+        continue
+      } else if (shouldSanitiseResult.sanitise) {
+        const sanitiseResult = await this.api.sanitiseMessage(message.messageId)
comment.body:
This is a fantastic suggestion and is the culmination of a lot of pain - excellent job! 💯 

I've applied this to:
- The `audit-log-api` to remove the `nextSanitiseCheck` field when sanitising an audit log
- The `sanitise-old-messages` lambda to stop updating `nextSanitiseCheck` if we've successfully sanitised an audit log
- `DynamoGateway` and `AuditLogDynamoGateway` to remove the `updateEntryUnconditionally` method, since there's no need for it anymore

* added `sanitiseMessage` method to `ApiClient`

An overview of the lambda is provided in [the README](../blob/BICAWS-1904-santise-old-messages/src/sanitise-old-messages/README.md)

- [Changelog](https://github.com/ljharb/es-abstract/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)

  dependency-type: indirect
  update-type: version-update:semver-minor
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
Add validation API dialog with data restoration
Fix and update tests
Updates for accessibility and screenreaders

Merge pull request #1510 from ministryofjustice/dependabot/npm_and_yarn/es-abstract-1.20.0

Bump es-abstract from 1.19.5 to 1.20.0
Disable minimum validation

Merge pull request #1533 from ministryofjustice/testable-validation-modals

Testable validation modals
Use Metadata Presenter 2.16.7

Move minimum validation into shared number validation example

Minimum validation will also need to act like a number validation. When
the maximum validation validator is added it will need to do the same
thing so use a shared example here.

Dynamically assign the correct validation object

Assign the correct validation object based upon the type of validator
that is requested.

If one does not exist then return the base validation object with the
errors.

Add the maximum validation validator

This adds the maximum validation validator to the enabled validations.
Refactor validation default metadata method
Rename base component validation shared example
Do not render partial if validator does not exist
Add acceptance tests for minimum and maximum validations
delete me
DATE - WIP

INC-544: Protected Characteristics tests (#170)

* INC-544: Protected Characteristics unit tests

* INC-544: Merge PC route tests in existing ones

...with the exception of tests specific to the new template PC page

* INC-544: set feature flag to true for Cypress tests; tests for PC selector and age page

* INC-544: AnalyticsPage's getTextFromTable() don't assume 13 cols

This method could potentially be used to extract text from other tables
which have a different number of columns (or trends without the current
month).

* INC-544: Moved/split 'Analytics' integration tests in 3 files

These tests are related (hence in the same directory) but fairly independent
(so they can go in different files).

We usually work on different pages so it's nice to be able to run tests
for a specific page on their own without having to comment tests out.
Plus the file was getting quite big so three files of 100-200 lines are better
than one huge file (files are still on the big side but it's an improvement)

* INC-544: Analytics int. tests: Moved getTextFromTable() to utils

* INC-544: Int. tests for PC graphs data

* INC-544: Fix to minor import/linting issues

* Revert "INC-544: Fix to minor import/linting issues"

This reverts commit b093822e26e33a5ccb8714b0c454060567ad6ff0.

Reverting this as it was the editor getting confused 🤦‍♂️.
The type is exported correctly by the module and `PageElement` is used
as a type in these contexts.

* INC-544: Analytics int. tests: Renamed parameter

As suggested in code review.

* INC-544: Analytics int. tests PR amendments

- test feedback banner is on each of the Analytics pages
- made tests structure shallow

* INC-544: Fixed linting problem.

Co-authored-by: Neil Mendum <neil.mendum@digital.justice.gov.uk>

INC-544: Int. tests: Factored out method to get chart tables (#172)

We had quite few methods with almost exact logic that returned a chart
table's rows. This can be generalised.
Update jest monorepo to v28
In 1253 - initial stab at phase 3 (#684)
